documentation.text:
@param _swapID is the id of the order to be fetched
 @notice `_swapID` must not be INVALID. it can be OPEN, CLOSED or EXPIRED.

continue with the refund function after expiration
 continue with the check order function

params._swapID: is the id of the order to be fetched

fundOrder(bytes32).details: this contract must be approved by the caller before calling this function

params._swapID: is the id of the order to be funded

params._secretKey: is the secret the issuer must provide and reveal to the investor. The investor will in turn use this secret to withdraw the security token from the htlc1400 contract
params._swapID: is the id of the order to withdrawn the usdt from

openOrder(bytes32,address,uint256,uint25.details: Issuer initializes the order with the same orderID in the htlc1400 contractThe issuer uses the ID to withdraw USDT from this contract, while the investor uses the ID to withdraw from the htlc1400 contract

params._expiration: is the time expected for this order to expire before a refund can enabled
params._investor: is the address that will fund this contract with the given _swapID
params._price: is the price of the security token to be purchased. This contract is funded by investor for this particular order
params._secretHash: is the hash of the secret set on this contract and htlc1400 for this particular swap ID
params._swapID: is the ID of the swap order. This ID must be valid on the htlc1400 contract for swap to occur

OpenedOrder(address,bytes32,uint256,uint.notice: continue with the refund function after expiration continue with the check order function

checkOrder(bytes32).notice: `_swapID` must not be INVALID. it can be OPEN, CLOSED or EXPIRED.

fundOrder(bytes32).notice: `_orderSwap[_swapID]._funded == false`, i.e the order must not be funded yet`_swapState[_swapID] == SwapState.OPEN` ,  i.e the order state must be opened

issuerWithdrawal(bytes32,bytes32).notice: the caller is the owner of the contractthe order must be OPENthe order must not be an expired orderthe hash of the secretKey must equal the hash in the order
